Basic Mobile Menu Functionality

How To Demo

On narrow screens, click/tap the icon in the upper-right to open and close the navigation menu. Note: It is open by default for demo purposes only, ordinarily it would begin in a closed state.

On wider screens, the navigation menu displays in a static horizontal row.

How It Works

A good practice is to use the least amount of JavaScript you need to produce the result. Here, the page listens for a click event on the hamburger/X button and simply toggles a class name on the navigation container. The menu's showing, hiding, etc. can then be handled entirely by CSS using that class name.

Alternate Option

I made a variation of this mobile nav menu where the menu "slides" down from the header instead of just appearing. Check it out.
